title: Barbados to Queen Elizabeth: Cheerio!
sub_head: The ‘Little England’ of the Caribbean becomes a republic after nearly four centuries of ties to the British Crown
body:
Barbados officially became a republic on Tuesday, ending almost four centuries of ties to the British monarchy in a midnight ceremony attended by Prince Charles.
The small Caribbean island, sometimes called “Little England,” became the first nation in nearly 30 years to sever its ties to the monarchy, after Mauritius became a republic in 1992. Queen Elizabeth II is still the sovereign over 15 independent nations, among them Canada, Australia and Jamaica.
